nodes.documentation:
@notice Orderbook is responsible for storing the orders and their priorities.
It's used as an consensus of which order should be executed.
nodes.name: Orderbook

nodes.documentation: @notice Only allow registered dark nodes.
nodes.name: onlyDarknode
openBuyOrder
openSellOrder
confirmOrder
cancelOrder

nodes.documentation:
buyOrder will return orderId of the given index in buy order list and true if exists.
Otherwise it will return empty bytes and false.
nodes.name: buyOrder

nodes.documentation:
sellOrder will return orderId of the given index in sell order list and true if exists.
Otherwise it will return empty bytes and false.
nodes.name: sellOrder

nodes.documentation: orderState will return status of the given orderID.
nodes.name: orderState

nodes.documentation: orderMatch will return a list of matched orders to the given orderID.
nodes.name: orderMatch

nodes.documentation:
orderPriority will return the priority of the given orderID.
The priority is the index of the order in the orderbook.
nodes.name: orderPriority

nodes.documentation:
orderTrader will return the trader of the given orderID.
Trader is the one who signs the message and does the actual trading.
nodes.name: orderTrader

nodes.documentation:
orderBroker will return the broker of the given orderID.
Broker is the one who represent the trader to send the tx.
nodes.name: orderBroker

nodes.documentation: orderConfirmer will return the darknode address which confirms the given orderID.
nodes.name: orderConfirmer

nodes.documentation: orderDepth will return the block depth of the orderId
nodes.name: orderDepth

nodes.documentation: orderBlockNumber will return the block number when the order being last modified.
nodes.name: orderBlockNumber

nodes.documentation: getOrdersCount will return the number of orders in the orderbook
nodes.name: getOrdersCount

nodes.documentation:
getOrder will return orderId of the given index in the orderbook list and true if exists.
Otherwise it will return empty bytes and false.
nodes.name: getOrder

nodes.documentation: getOrder will return order details of the orders starting from the offset.
nodes.name: getOrders
